head.supplied: Botan. Gardens Melbourne ¶ 23/3/64 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to your letter of the 21 of March, ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that the Trustees of the Royal Park have granted to the Trades Committee th...

div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter and minute book, p. 11-12, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
In reply to your letter of the 21 of March,
Letter not found. I have the honor to inform you, that the Trustees of the Royal Park have granted to the Trades Committee the permission to occupy certain grounds at the Park during the contemplated fete on 21 April next, provided that due care be taken to prevent fire and damage to trees and property. To effect satisfactory arrangements for this purpose it will be necessary that the gentlemen of the Trades Committee communicate early with Mr. George Sprigg the Secretary of the Acclim. Society for the selection of the sites and for the protection of the property vested in the Trustees.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p: Sign. F. Mueller Hon. Secr. of the Trustees
